holidays.name: World Penguin Day 🐧
holidays.description: Celebrate everyone's favorite tuxedoed birds, the penguins! It's the day to appreciate their quirky wobbles and adorable waddles, while learning about penguin conservation.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the annual northward migration of penguins on this date in the Southern Hemisphere.
holidays.funFact: Did you know some penguins propose to their mates with a special pebble? Talk about 'rock-solid' relationships!

holidays.name: DNA Day 🧬
holidays.description: Dive into the double helix and celebrate the discovery of DNA's structure. It's a day for genetics geeks and curious minds to marvel at life's genetic blueprint.
holidays.origin: Marks the 1953 discovery of the DNA double helix by Watson and Crick.
holidays.funFact: If you unraveled all the DNA in your body, it would stretch from the Earth to the Sun and back over 300 times!

holidays.name: Zipper Day 🧷
holidays.description: A quirky nod to the humble zipper, that little invention which keeps our pants up and our bags closed! Celebrate its convenience and ingenuity.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the April 25, 1913 patent date for the modern zipper by Gideon Sundback.
holidays.funFact: The original zippers were called 'clasp lockers' and were used on boots before becoming a clothing staple.

holidays.name: Arbor Day (Observed in some US states) 🌳
holidays.description: A day to plant a tree and appreciate the leafy green wonders that give us oxygen, shade, and beauty.
holidays.origin: Varies by state; some celebrate on April 25 to honor tree planting and environmental stewardship.
holidays.funFact: The first Arbor Day was in 1872, and over one million trees were planted on that day alone!
